title: max read depth
body: Does SNPSVM enforce a maximum read depth, not using more than X many reads to call a variant.  I'm using haloplex so read depth is an issue.

title: SNPSVM needs paired read to do variant calling?
body:
use a single read BAM, it gives off following warning, and produces an VCF without calls.

Loading module class snpsvm.app.Predictor
Calling SNPs over 22556 bases with 4 threads in 1 chunks
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Inappropriate call if not paired read
        at net.sf.samtools.SAMRecord.requireReadPaired(SAMRecord.java:675)
        at net.sf.samtools.SAMRecord.getMateUnmappedFlag(SAMRecord.java:702)
        at snpsvm.bamreading.BamWindow.expand(BamWindow.java:263)
        at snpsvm.bamreading.BamWindow.advanceTo(BamWindow.java:169)
        at snpsvm.bamreading.AlignmentColumn.advanceTo(AlignmentColumn.java:173)
        at snpsvm.bamreading.ReferenceBAMEmitter.emitWindow(ReferenceBAMEmitter.java:149)
        at snpsvm.bamreading.SNPCaller.run(SNPCaller.java:75)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1146)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:679)
